intro: Phyllanthus aspericaulis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal applications.
